verb.description: Take (someone) away illegally by force or deception; kidnap.
examples: the millionaire who disappeared may have been abducted

verb.description: (of a muscle) move (a limb or part) away from the midline of the body or from another part.

origin: Early 17th century: from Latin abduct- led away, from the verb abducere, from ab- away, from + ducere to lead.
